title: 108_hr947
content: The "School Capacity Relief Act" allows for the transfer of students to schools that are at or above capacity. The "School Capacity Relief Act" allows for the transfer of students to schools that are at or above capacity, with specific amendments made to sections 1116(b) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 regarding student transfers. The "School Capacity Relief Act" permits local educational agencies to prevent student transfers to schools already at capacity to avoid increasing class sizes above state-prescribed limits. The "School Capacity Relief Act" allows local educational agencies to avoid increasing school capacity for student transfers under certain conditions. This includes cases where all public schools served by the agency are identified for improvement or corrective action. The "School Capacity Relief Act" allows local educational agencies to establish cooperative agreements with other agencies for student transfers in cases where schools are identified for improvement, corrective action, or are at capacity. SEC. 3. GRANTS FOR INCREASING SCHOOL CAPACITY. Title IV of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include grants for increasing school capacity under PART D. Grants may be awarded to eligible local educational agencies by the Secretary for increasing capacity at high-performance schools. Funds must be used solely for measures to enhance capacity, such as facility renovations, hiring teachers, or purchasing instructional materials. Agencies must submit an application to the Secretary to seek a grant under this section. "Definitions for eligible local educational agency and high-performance school are provided in this part. Authorization of appropriations is granted for fiscal years 2004 through 2007. A new section on Increasing School Capacity is added to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965." "Part D--Increasing School Capacity includes grants, definitions, and authorization of appropriations. Section 1116(b) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to establish limits on transportation for transferring students."
